summary: This is an email chain from August 8, 2019, regarding a technical issue with the NICEVision software at multiple Federal Bureau of Prisons (FBOP) facilities. The email discusses a database error preventing administrators from unlocking accounts and includes troubleshooting suggestions and support contacts.

persons.name: Jeff McKenzie
persons.context: He is a support technician at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions who is working on resolving the NICEVision software issue reported by multiple FBOP facilities.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: He is mentioned as a technical support contact for the NICEVision software but is reported to be out of the office when the issue arises.

connections.description: Both are involved in technical support for the NICEVision software used by FBOP facilities.

events.title: NICEVision Software Database Error
events.description: Multiple FBOP facilities report a database error with the NICEVision software that prevents administrators from unlocking accounts, occurring after a software update.

keyFacts: The document is an email chain dated August 8, 2019, concerning a technical issue with NICEVision software at FBOP facilities.
The issue is a 'Database Error' that prevents administrators from unlocking accounts and appears to have started after a software update.
Multiple FBOP facilities are affected, including FCI Otisville (NY), FCC Terre Haute (IN), and FDC Houston.
Jeff McKenzie of SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions is actively working on resolving the issue.
The email includes standard confidentiality disclaimers for SigNet Technologies.
